name: House Malbleat
description: A chaotic longhorn breggle house ruling the eastern portion of the High Wold, centered on Redwraith Manor. Lord Gryphius Malbleat is a refined aesthete and sadist with occult interests and bitter enmity toward Lord Ramius.

domains: The eastern portion of the High Wold region in the south-east of Dolmenwood, encompassing the towns of Lankshorn and Dreg.

enclaves.name: Redwraith Manor
enclaves.notes: Seat and home of Lord Malbleat, four miles north of Lankshorn.

enclaves.name: Lankshorn
enclaves.notes: Market town under Malbleat’s control; frequent visits; Father Dobey is vicar.

enclaves.name: Dreg
enclaves.notes: Fishing village/port at the far eastern extent of Malbleat’s domain; Madame Shantywood has notable clout here.

enclaves.name: Shagsend
enclaves.notes: Fortified hamlet ruled by Hoblewort the sorcerer, servant of Malbleat.

resources.name: Ring of Vanishing
resources.description: A Ring of Vanishing (p410), enabling covert movement and abductions.

resources.name: Occult Library and Necromancer Tome
resources.description: Extensive occult library; includes a human-skin-bound tome holding a trapped necromancer soul (worth 12,000gp) that can cast Geas once per week for a familiar reader.

resources.name: Coterie of Alchemists and Minor Sorcerers
resources.description: A coterie of alchemists and minor sorcerers serving Malbleat’s schemes.

resources.name: Hounds and Retainers
resources.description: Two great black hounds and a small soldiery of shorthorns; household servants and groundsmen.

resources.name: Influence in Lankshorn
resources.description: Malbleat has the ear of Father Dobey, vicar of Lankshorn (p158), aiding leverage over local affairs.

goals.name: Depose Lord Ramius
goals.notes: To depose Lord Ramius, whom he envies and connives against. To continue cultivating the favour of Baron Hogwarsh. To unlock the arcane secrets of his semi-mythical, sorcerous ancestor Lord Gnarlgruff.

goals.name: Cultivate the Favour of Baron Hogwarsh
goals.notes: Maintain and deepen influence with Baron Hogwarsh, who once intervened in the Ramius/Malbleat feud.

goals.name: Unlock the Arcane Secrets of Lord Gnarlgruff
goals.notes: Pursue occult research tied to Malbleat’s semi-mythical ancestor.

goals.name: Hold the Eastern High Wold (Lankshorn & Dreg)
goals.notes: Keep tight control over Lankshorn, Dreg, and fortified Shagsend in the face of rival longhorn schemes.

action_library.name: Exploit the genealogical claim that Malbleat is rightful head of House Ramius

on_complete.text: Old parchments are read aloud in low halls—some insist Malbleat’s bloodline proves the truer claim.

action_library.name: Leverage Father Dobey’s favour to steer Lankshorn’s public voice

on_complete.text: A sermon in Lankshorn lands strangely kind to Redwraith—parables with sharp edges for Malbleat’s enemies.

action_library.name: Study the necromancer tome to extract binding and geas-lore

on_complete.text: Candles burn late at Redwraith; pages whisper, and the air tastes of old graves.

action_library.name: Use the Ring of Vanishing to abduct or sabotage rival agents

on_complete.text: A messenger vanishes between lantern pools; only hoof-marks and a single black hair remain.

action_library.name: Increase levies, watch, and intimidation to tighten control over Lankshorn
Secure Dreg’s port and trade, countering Shantywood influence

on_complete.text: Dockside gossip turns: tariffs shift, guards change, and Shantywood’s smile is less certain in Dreg.

organization.nobles: Lords Ramius and Malbleat (longhorns of ancient stock) and the upstart half-breggle Lord Murkin rule large portions of the High Wold.
organization.longhorn_elite: Longhorn courtiers and knights under the command of the nobles.
organization.shorthorns: Serving class filling roles as household servants, messengers, guards, and soldiers.

lord_gryphius_malbleat.appearance: MALBLEAT A mature longhorn man of noble, philosophical air. Malbleat is tall (almost 7′), graceful, slender, and has black fur with a silver nose. Dresses in refined silks, with a fashionable neck ruff. Renowned for his love of poetry and his elegance in the ballroom. Dabbles in matters occult.
lord_gryphius_malbleat.demeanour: Chaotic; Refined aesthete, sadist. Delights in humiliating those of lower rank. Has a habit of smiling at uncomfortably inappropriate junctures.
desires: To depose Lord Ramius, whom he envies and connives against
To continue cultivating the favour of Baron Hogwarsh
To unlock the arcane secrets of his semi-mythical, sorcerous ancestor Lord Gnarlgruff.

necromancer_tome.name: Necromancer Tome
necromancer_tome.notes: A Ring of Vanishing (p410). An extensive occult library, including a tome, bound in human skin, which contains the trapped soul of a necromancer (worth 12,000gp). One who gains a familiarity with the tome can command the spirit to cast a Geas spell once a week.

lord_gryphius_malbleat.family: Seven wives (two longhorns and five humans— including Bronywyn Baldricke, daughter of Berkmaster Baldricke—p159). Malbleat is the younger half-brother (to different mothers) of Lord Ramius.
lord_gryphius_malbleat.servants: A coterie of alchemists and minor sorcerers. Two great black hounds. Groundsmen, cooks, butlers, etc. A small soldiery of shorthorns. Malbleat has the ear of Father Dobey, the vicar of Lankshorn (p158).
lord_gryphius_malbleat.combat_stats: Longhorn (DMB). Malbleat is a magician of some small talent, and has Glyph of Sealing and Vapours of Dream memorised.

father_dobey.notes: Vicar of Lankshorn (p158); Malbleat has his ear.

hoblewort.notes: Sorcerer who rules Shagsend; servant of Malbleat.

madame_shantywood.notes: Ruler of independent Shantywood Isle; has notable clout in Dreg.

origins.earliest_mortals:
The origins of breggles are lost in antiquity. They have lived
in the environs of Dolmenwood for as long as any records 
show, and were the first mortal Kindred to dwell under the 
forest’s frost-rimed boughs, in ancient days when the Cold 
Prince ruled supreme.
Ancient Nobility
The longhorns hold their distant forebears to be those 
bold few breggles who ventured into the ice-clad courts 
of the Cold Prince and pledged him their fealty, desiring 
the elevation of their own kind. These early days among
the high-born of Fairy instilled in the longhorns a love of 
all that is noble, a proclivity which drives them to this day.

sorcerous_blood.overview:
In addition to their political might, longhorns possess 
a degree of sorcerous power, derived from their ancient 
dealings with the Cold Prince. The gaze of the longhorns 
is greatly feared among the ranks of human aristocracy. 
Petty human lords often enlist sorcerous aid when attend-
ing the court of a longhorn.

drune_enmity.overview:
Following the betrayal of the Drune by the longhorn 
woman Hraigl, some 1,500 years ago (see History, p14), a 
bitter hatred between Drune and breggles has smouldered.
In the Service of the Duchy
The longhorn aristocrats are counted among the noble 
houses loyal to the Duke of Brackenwold, ruling the High 
Wold side by side with humans. Intermarriage of breggle 
and human nobles is commonplace.
Nominally Follow the Pluritine Church
The longhorn nobles and their subjects are nominally 
aligned with the Church, though their loyalty is born out 
of political convenience, rather than devotion. It is some-
times noted that the feeling may be mutual—no breggle 
saints exist within the host of the blessed.

shared_objectives.maintain_lordship:
At many points in history has an imperious human noble 
of one kind or another emerged to challenge the long-
horns’ right to dominion in the High Wold. Always have 
the tenacious longhorns prevailed, but the risk of outside 
meddling in breggle rulership of the region remains.
shared_objectives.extend_south:
Collectively, but primarily as individuals, the longhorns 
seek to reverse the trend of the gradual human domination 
of the High Wold and extend their rule further south. Each 
of the nobles has his eye on the courts of High-Hankle and 
the throne of the foolish Baron Hogwarsh.
shared_objectives.destroy_drune:
The longhorns hate the Drune for their power, arrogance, 
and long-standing vendetta against all breggle-kind. They 
seek to eradicate the Drune from the High Wold and bring 
the lands of Dwelmfurgh under longhorn rule.

schemes.rivalries:
SCHEMES
Vanquish Rival Longhorn Houses
The longhorn nobles are greatly occupied with bitter 
in-fighting, with petty familial rivalries amplified to 
blood-feud and vendetta. Each noble wishes to achieve 
dominance over his kin, whether by political subjuga-
tion, warfare, or sorcery. The longhorn nobles’ scheming 
to outdo one another largely hinders the advancement of 
their shared goals.

summary.domain: The eastern portion of the High Wold region in the south-east of Dolmenwood, encompassing the towns of Lankshorn and Dreg.
summary.seat: Redwraith Manor, located in the woods four miles north of Lankshorn.
summary.head: Lord Gryphius Malbleat, longhorn breggle. A refined aesthete known for his cruelty and his bitter enmity toward his elder half-brother, Lord Ramius.

house.ramius_divided:
House Ramius Divided
Twenty-two years ago, unearthed genealogical documents 
purportedly revealed Lord Malbleat as the rightful head of 
House Ramius, through the line of his mother, Lady Shank-
hollow. Lord Ramius’ interpretation of the documents 
naturally differed, and a feud ensued, growing quickly to 
violence. Baron Hogwarsh (then a mere youth) intervened, 
ruling that the lands of House Ramius should be divided. 
Malbleat was granted the eastern portion and Ramius the 
western.

house.murkin_aggressions:
Lord Murkin’s Aggressions
Lord Murkin has eyes on the lands of his southerly neigh-
bour—the human House Nodlock—and is amassing troops 
near the border. Only the protection of Lord Ramius (whom 
Lord Nodlock is a lackey of) prevents outright war.
